frontmatter.title: Fellowship in review
frontmatter.description: Since tomorrow is my last day as a Knight-Mozilla OpenNews Fellow I feel the need to revisit this past 10 months to document what I did, what I left unfinished and some things I'd like to do in the future.

frontmatter.title: On keeping Web Development weird for the next generation
frontmatter.description: Enjoying a Spring Friday in December, looking for ways to ruin my existence, I was inclined to read a couple of pending resources from the excellent Rust Docs. Catching errors at compile time, Static type-checking, immutable bindings, we can do these things now in JavaScript — that’s amazing!

frontmatter.title: Universal rendering with preact
frontmatter.description: In this article I explain a technique and conventions to follow in order to achieve Universal rendering (the ability to render an app both client and server side) using preact, node and redux.
